result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Marcus Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $900.00 to victim Donovan G.-A. To be paid first.

Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements after restitution is paid.  
**Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended supervision.  If not paid, balance would convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No controlled substances or alcohol.  
No contact with victims Donovan G.-A. and Donrico R.
Any programs the Department deems appropriate.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.
*Defendant is eligible for Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving four (4) years.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Marcus Parker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Darryl Marcus Parker not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Sentencing.  The Court is currently in trial and unavailable.  Parties requested an adjournment.  Matter is adjourned to November 9, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for sentencing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Darryl Marcus Parker not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to court calendar congestion, case could not proceed to sentencing on today's date.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 30.
Clerk:  jms
from victim, Donovan G.A., filed.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with Attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Sentencing hearing.  When the Court was questioning the Defendant as to his plea, the Court was concerned about factual basis of the plea.  Discussion held off the record with counsels.  The matter was adjourned to October 15, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for sentencing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

As to COUNTS 1 AMENDED, 2 AMENDED, and COUNT 3 AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 9/08/15. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Sidebar placed on the record. Judge recused herself from this case and ordered it be transferred to another court. Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Conen, Br. 30.
Case adjourned to Branch 30.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State filed a Second Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNTS 1 & 3 remain the same. 

COUNT 2- Robbery (Use of Force) - PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.32(1)(a), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class E Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the second amended information. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense counsel contacted the court requesting this matter be set for a projected plea prior to the jury trial date. State notified. Case adjourned to 9/03/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Plea Hearing in Branch 25. Sheriff's Department notified to have the defendant produced. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defendant entered a NOT GUILTY plea as to COUNT 4 of the Amended Information previously filed on 8/13/15. Parties advise the court this matter is still in a trial posture. State placed offer on the record, which the defendant rejected. Court made rulings on defense motions in limine. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/8/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Defense Motion in Limine  received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense Witness List  received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Reqeusted Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of DeAnn Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNTS 1-3 remain the same.

COUNT 4- Armed Robbery, contrary to sec. 943.32(2), 939.50(3)(c) Wis. Stats., a Class C Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading. State will place the offer on the record at the next court date. Defense counsel requested an additional final pretrial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/08/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  9/22/15.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Darryl Marcus Parker not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court set the following schedule for any motions to be filed: movant to file by 7/14/15; response due by 8/03/15; reply due by 8/10/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions, substantive jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week prior to the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Darryl Marcus Parker not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Darryl Marcus Parker in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
